channel.title: [noob] Compiler help [noob]
channel.description:
So, i've use the search bar a bunch of times but i can't find anything to fix this.
I'm trying to compile a client i'm working on. i just started.
And i keep getting the 'System cannot find the path specified, press any key to continue...'
I have this [code]You have the recommended Java installed (Version 6 Update 13). [/code]
My compiler looks like this.
[code]@echo off title Compiling... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java title Compiled pause[/code]
Any help?

item.title: [noob] Compiler help [noob]
item.dc:creator: @wwe4eva wwe4eva
item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

Yeh but its not neccesary

Read full topic

item.title: [noob] Compiler help [noob]
item.dc:creator: @wwe4eva wwe4eva
item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

YOURS

[code]@echo off title Compiling... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java title Compiled pause[/code]

MINE

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

apart from mine been _12 do you see any differences? yes. dont have title compiled after the program files also

have u added enviroment variables. if not do this…

Start > Right click My Computer > Properties > Advanced > Enviromental Varibales.

The you should see 2 sets of boxes, User variables and system variables.

On user variables click new. Variable Name : PATH Variable Value : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin click ok
Again on user variables click new. Variable Name : CLASSPATH Variable Value : *C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASAPATH%; Yes, you need the *

Click ok until all of the windows have gone, double click ur compiler and voila. Working. If not you havnt done something right. Make sure everything is right.

Read full topic

item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

what ever file it says:

@echo off title Compiling... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java title Compiled pause change that jdk version to your own.
